abstract: Mr. Elson’s 1966 cover article about new approaches to thinking about God caused an uproar, but it was an example of his serious coverage of ideas.
snippet: Mr. Elson’s 1966 cover article about new approaches to thinking about God caused an uproar, but it was an example of his serious coverage of ideas.
lead_paragraph: All journalists want to write a story that makes a big splash. John T. Elson, the religion editor at Time magazine, was no exception. But in 1966 he got more than he bargained for.

headline.main: John T. Elson, Editor Who Asked ‘Is God Dead?’ at Time, Dies at 78
headline.print_headline: John T. Elson, Editor Who Asked ‘Is God Dead?’ at Time, Dies at 78
